maml:description.maml:para: Create a connection to your Okta org.

Creates a persistent connection to your Okta org. This connection will persist as long as your PowerShell is open or until you remove or re-import the Okta module, or until you run the Disconnect-Okta command.

maml:Description.maml:para: The full URL of your Okta org. This must use the "https://" prefix.

Your Okta API token. This token can be generated in the Okta admin console, and should be protected as a privileged credential. Be aware that API permissions for the token are the same as the permissions for the user who created the token.

Your Okta API token. This token can be generated in the Okta admin console, and should be protected as a privileged credential. Be aware that API permissions for the token are the same as the permissions for the user who created the token.
The full URL of your Okta org. This must use the "https://" prefix.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example demonstrates connecting to an Okta org "MyOrg."

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a connection to an Okta org.
Remove an existing connection to an Okta org. Use this command to make sure your API token is removed from memory in your current PowerShell session.
Gets one or more Okta apps.
The Get-OktaApp cmdlet returns one or more Okta applications, either specified by Id or by supplying a filter string.

maml:Description.maml:para: If specified, will return all apps from the Okta org.
The -Filter parameter can be used to return a subset of apps that match the filter string. Only a subset of properties are supported for filtering:
status user.id group.id credentials.signing.kid
Refer to Okta's API documentation to learn more about creating a filter string.
Specifies an Okta group and will retrieve the apps assigned to that group.
The Id of the application to be returned.
Specifies an Okta user and will retrieve the apps assigned to that user.
If specified, will return all apps from the Okta org.
The -Filter parameter can be used to return a subset of apps that match the filter string. Only a subset of properties are supported for filtering:
status user.id group.id credentials.signing.kid
Refer to Okta's API documentation to learn more about creating a filter string.
Specifies an Okta group and will retrieve the apps assigned to that group.
The Id of the application to be returned.
Specifies an Okta user and will retrieve the apps assigned to that user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This examples retrieves an Okta application by its Id.
This example retrieves all Okta apps from connected org.
This example demonstrates using the filter parameter to retrieve applications that are active.
This example shows how you can retrieve apps that are assigned to the user "matt" using the pipeline.
This example shows how you can retrieve apps that are assigned to a group using the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets group assignments for an application.
Returns a group assignment object for an app. This object can be used to retrieve the group objects.

maml:Description.maml:para: The app to return group assignments for.
The app to return group assignments for.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the group assignments for an app.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets details of the current Okta connection.
Gets details of the current Okta connection.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the Okta connection details.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets all of a user's enrolled factors.
Gets all of a user's enrolled factors.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Okta user to return factors for.
The Okta user to return factors for.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the factors a user has enrolled.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more Okta groups.
Gets one or more Okta groups by specifying the group Id, or searches based on a filter string.

maml:Description.maml:para: Will return all groups in the Okta org.
Specifies a filter string to return a subset of groups.
Specifies the Id of the group.
Specifies a user to return group membership for.
Will return all groups in the Okta org.
Specifies a filter string to return a subset of groups.
Specifies the Id of the group.
Specifies a user to return group membership for.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a single group by its Id property.
Get all the groups in your Okta org.
Get any groups of type OKTA_GROUP by specifying a filter string.
Get groups with user matt as a member.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more Okta system log events entries.
Gets one or more Okta system log events entries. These events can be filtered by type, by target objects and by using date/time ranges.

maml:Description.maml:para: If specified, will return all events in the given time range.

The end of the time range you'd like to retrieve events for. If not specified, the default value is now. -EndDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

The beginning date of the time range you'd like retrieve events for. If -StartDate isn't specified, the default value is 7 days prior to the current date and time. -StartDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

The end of the time range you'd like to retrieve events for. If not specified, the default value is now. -EndDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

Specifies a filter string to perform an event log search. Most properties of events are supported for filtering, including nested properties. See the Okta API System Log document link to learn more about how to compose these filter strings.

The beginning date of the time range you'd like retrieve events for. If -StartDate isn't specified, the default value is 7 days prior to the current date and time. -StartDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

The end of the time range you'd like to retrieve events for. If not specified, the default value is now. -EndDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

Specifies keywords to perform an exact match search for log events. These keywords should be specified as a single string and separated by spaces. A total of 10 keywords is supported, each with a maximum length of 40 characters. Keywords are not case-sensitive. See the System Log API reference page to learn more about keyword searches for log events.

The beginning date of the time range you'd like retrieve events for. If -StartDate isn't specified, the default value is 7 days prior to the current date and time. -StartDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

The end of the time range you'd like to retrieve events for. If not specified, the default value is now. -EndDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

The beginning date of the time range you'd like retrieve events for. If -StartDate isn't specified, the default value is 7 days prior to the current date and time. -StartDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

The Id of the Okta object to retrieve events for. This can be nearly any Okta object type such as a user, group or app. -TargetId accepts input via the pipeline, so go ahead and pipe in a user or group object and see what happens!
If specified, will return all events in the given time range.

The end of the time range you'd like to retrieve events for. If not specified, the default value is now. -EndDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

Specifies a filter string to perform an event log search. Most properties of events are supported for filtering, including nested properties. See the Okta API System Log document link to learn more about how to compose these filter strings.

Specifies keywords to perform an exact match search for log events. These keywords should be specified as a single string and separated by spaces. A total of 10 keywords is supported, each with a maximum length of 40 characters. Keywords are not case-sensitive. See the System Log API reference page to learn more about keyword searches for log events.

The beginning date of the time range you'd like retrieve events for. If -StartDate isn't specified, the default value is 7 days prior to the current date and time. -StartDate can always be used to limit the time range of events returned, regardless of the parameter set.

The Id of the Okta object to retrieve events for. This can be nearly any Okta object type such as a user, group or app. -TargetId accepts input via the pipeline, so go ahead and pipe in a user or group object and see what happens!

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get events by event type.
Get events for a specified user. This command is equivalent to clicking on the system log link from a user's page in the Okta admin console.
Get events for a specified app. This will return any events where the app was the target of the operation.
Get events for a specified group. This will return any events where the group was the target of the operation.
Get all events in a specified time range.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets Okta sign on and password policies.
Gets Okta sign on and password policies.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Id of the policy to retrieve.
The type of policies you'd like to retrieve. Can be either Password or OktaSignOn.
The Id of the policy to retrieve.
The type of policies you'd like to retrieve. Can be either Password or OktaSignOn.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a policy by its Id.
Get all policies of type OktaSignOn.
Get all policies of type Password.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more Okta policy rules.
Gets one or more Okta policy rules. Accepts a policy If via the pipeline and a rule Id can also be supplied to retrieve only a particular rule.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Id of the policy to retrieve rules for. This can be specified as a string, or by passing one or more policy objects via the pipeline.
The Id of the rule you'd like to retrieve.
The Id of the policy to retrieve rules for. This can be specified as a string, or by passing one or more policy objects via the pipeline.
The Id of the rule you'd like to retrieve.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all rules for a policy.
Get a specific policy rule.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more Okta users.
Gets one or more Okta users. Users can be specified by Id, searched for using a filter, or enumerated by app assignment or group membership.

maml:Description.maml:para: If specified, will return all users in the Okta org.
If specified, will return all users assigned to the app.
Specifies a filter string to perform a search of users with. Any users that match the conditions of the filter string will be returned. Many user properties are supported for filtering such as:
status lastUpdated id profile.login profile.firstName
To learn more about user filters, see the API User document link.
Specifies an Okta group for which you'd like to return the members.

The unique identifier of the user to retrieve. This can be the Id or Login value, or can be the login shortname if its unambiguous. To retrieve the currently connected user, use "me" instead of an Id.
If specified, will return all users in the Okta org.
If specified, will return all users assigned to the app.
Specifies a filter string to perform a search of users with. Any users that match the conditions of the filter string will be returned. Many user properties are supported for filtering such as:
status lastUpdated id profile.login profile.firstName
To learn more about user filters, see the API User document link.
Specifies an Okta group for which you'd like to return the members.

The unique identifier of the user to retrieve. This can be the Id or Login value, or can be the login shortname if its unambiguous. To retrieve the currently connected user, use "me" instead of an Id.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get a single Okta user.
Get any active users by specifying a filter string.
Get all users in the current Okta org.
Get all users assigned to a particular app.
Get all users that are members of a particular group.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the administrative roles assigned to an Okta user.
Returns the administrative roles assigned to an Okta user.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Okta user to retrieve administrative roles for.
The Okta user to retrieve administrative roles for.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the administrative roles assigned to the user "matt."
